definition: to get money/to accumulate money
to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: You need to know how to use money form other sources to buy real estate with nothing down.
sentences.chinese: 你必须知道从其它地方搞钱，以实现零首付。

sentences.english: Market economy is by no means equal to money making economy.
sentences.chinese: 市场经济绝不等于“搞钱”经济。

sentences.english: He got his money in dishonest ways.
sentences.chinese: 他以不正当的方式搞钱。

sentences.english: Rather than get money in such a dishonest way, he would beg in the street.
sentences.chinese: 他宁可沿街乞讨，也不愿意以如此不正当的手段搞钱。

sentences.english: These people are just interested in making money.
A young man down on his luck might do anything to get money.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人在走霉运的时候可能会不顾一切去搞钱。

sentences.english: Don't get money by dishonest means.
sentences.chinese: 不要用不正当的手段搞钱。

definition: lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck
to make extra money
(coll.) to grab money/to rake in money
(coll.) to gain profit (usu. by underhand means)
to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
to buy a title/to use wealth to acquire office
dirty money
to buy and sell at a profit/to speculate
to collect money/to raise funds (for charity)
to be corrupt/corruption/to embezzle
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to swindle/to cheat
speculation and profiteering (idiom); buying and selling on speculation
to give change
to raise money
to borrow money/to lend money
